page.title: 12MELKSHAM TWINNING
page.content: Melksham is twinned with Avon in France which is 60km south of Paris. The twinning started in the 1970's. The idea was thought up by Cannon Townsend, who was vicar of St.Michael's church..The people in each town meet once a year. Each time, about 50 people come over. It costs about Â£50 to come over to England or go over to France. There are 2 twin schools in France; the College de la Valee for 11 to 16 year olds, and the Lycee Technique Uruguay France for 16 to 18 year olds. When the adults come over they stay for a week. Every time the French people come over they enjoy it a lot.
